body_html:
Incidentally, would you be able to explain why defining the lambda with an already-constructed tensor gives a poor result? Or how I might be able to use tf.where to achieve this result of:

if global_step == 2, then set learning_rate = 0.01
if global_step == 4, then set learning_rate = 0.001
else, keep learning_rate the same
body_text:
Incidentally, would you be able to explain why defining the lambda with an already-constructed tensor gives a poor result? Or how I might be able to use tf.where to achieve this result of:

body:
Incidentally, would you be able to explain why defining the lambda with an already-constructed tensor gives a poor result? Or how I might be able to use tf.where to achieve this result of:

if global_step == 2, then set learning_rate = 0.01
if global_step == 4, then set learning_rate = 0.001
else, keep learning_rate the same
